page.title: 14Playground Games,Liskeard
page.content: A junior school survey found 70 names of playground games,30 of which were versions of the game'Tig'where one child is'It'and has to touch or 'Tig' another.This person becomes 'It'.The variations included having a number of safe bases;using a ball;joining hands when tigged;'tigged'people having to freeze but later released by free people;and even 'tigging'by jumping on somebody's shadow.Other popular games were ball games including football, hand cricket, piggy in the middle and several throwing games.Language games mainly involved answering questions or the checking of letters in a child's name before the child could perform a set action.Rhyming games usually meant that the players were eliminated one by one as various actions were performed to a rhyme.Less popular were body contact,solo and silent games.
